narrative.summary: A bullish trade on KCH6 (Coffee March 2026) resulted in a minimal $5.00 loss, though the trade lacked any documented strategy, trigger, or thesis, making it impossible to evaluate execution quality.
what_went_right: Loss was contained to a minimal $5.00, suggesting position sizing or quick exit prevented larger damage.
The trade was closed, indicating some risk management discipline was exercised.
what_went_wrong: No trading strategy was defined or documented before entry.
No entry trigger was specified, indicating the trade may have been impulsive or arbitrary.
Entry confidence was recorded at 0.0, meaning the trade was entered with no measurable conviction — a critical red flag that was ignored.
No original thesis was articulated, making it impossible to manage the trade rationally or evaluate its outcome meaningfully.
Without a thesis or trigger, there was no framework for knowing when to exit, hold, or add to the position.
Incomplete trade logging suggests a breakdown in pre-trade discipline and process adherence.
narrative.lesson: Never enter a trade with 0.0 confidence and no documented thesis — if you cannot write down why you are entering, what would prove you wrong, and what your exit criteria are, the trade should not be placed.
narrative.rule_suggestion: Mandatory Pre-Trade Checklist Rule: Block any trade entry where confidence score is below 0.3, strategy field is empty, or original thesis is not documented; all three fields must be populated before an order is submitted.

key_lesson: Never enter a trade with 0.0 confidence and no documented thesis — if you cannot write down why you are entering, what would prove you wrong, and what your exit criteria are, the trade should not be placed.
